page.title: 12ECOLOGY/FOOTPATHS,Headcorn.
page.content: Miles of{Public footpaths}criss-cross this countryside East of HEADCORN village in the{Weald of Kent.}They follow the hedgerows across the fields and between roads,or link neighbouring farms - the Countryman's "short cut" in fact. Many of these footpaths are walked regularly by the local {"Foot- {Paths Group",}who meet on the first Sunday of each Month. This group also make sure the paths do not get too overgrown,but are kept in a reasonable state of access. A variety of{Birds and{Insects}can be seen when walking the footpaths. This area is rich in {Bees, Butterflies}and{Dragonflies,}and {Wild flowers}grow in profusion. A Pocket book on any of these subjects is a great help in recognising any of Natures wonders along the way.
